LanguageData.Fishing.helpText:
Place a 'fishing zone' where your colonists will fish. Larger bodies of water are better for fishing.

Fishing reduces the fish population in a body of water.

Avoid overfishing - fewer fish will be caught if a body of water has under 300 fish.

Colonists with a high animals skill catch more fish faster.
LanguageData.Fishing.label: თევზაობა
LanguageData.Gravship.helpText:
Build a gravship around your grav engine. When you launch the ship will carry the entire structure to a new map.

Launching the gravship destroys the current map. You can build a grav anchor to prevent this.

To launch, a gravship needs:
 - Pilot console
 - Fuel tanks
 - Thrusters

Research 'basic gravtech' to unlock these.

You can only build a limited amount of substructure. To increase this limit, find gravcores and gravlite panels.

Gravship substructure can be removed using the 'remove foundation' designator.

Your grav engine will occasionally detect gravtech around the planet and mark it on your world map.
LanguageData.Gravship.label: სამარხი
LanguageData.Orbit.helpText:
On the world map, use the 'view planet' and 'view orbit' buttons to switch between planetary and orbital views.

You can travel to orbital locations using transport pods, shuttles, or gravships.

Colonists need vacsuits or other advanced armor to survive in the vacuum of space.

If using a gravship, make sure it's well-heated. Build oxygen pumps to maintain breathable air and enclose your ship with airtight walls and doors. Avoid using wood or stone for exterior walls and doors.

Plan your return trip before you launch. Living in orbit for a long time is very challenging. Getting stranded in orbit is deadly.
LanguageData.Orbit.label: ორბიტა
